channel.title: Projects on Manuel Rocha
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Manuel Rocha

item.title: Genetic and environmental controls of traits affecting profitability of pulp & solid-wood production from plantation-grown Eucalyptus nitens
item.description: Eucalyptus nitens is the main plantation eucalypt in Tasmania with around 208,000 hectares, where it is grown for pulp, timber and other engineered wood products. In Tasmania, over the period 2015-19, it has been estimated that around 4% of hardwood log volume will come from plantations managed under solid-wood silvicultural regimes (i.e. thinned and pruned) and this is predicted to increase due to the need to replace the diminishing supply of logs from native forest resources.
